messages.message: Using Cursor’s Composer to add a feature flag for me. I just copy and pasted from the feature gate google doc, and it can also run the make commands. Pretty neat!
You might have to edit the suggestions, but it’s pretty close!
Just be sure to review it carefully.
Use another AI tool to review :smirk:

i wonder if there's a way to share prompts in Cursor for common operations?

in the meantime, can you copy-paste your prompt here? @Paul H
@alex.zhou ^ if there’s a way to share prompts in Cursor?

My prompt was:
```I want to add a feature flag "AIHUB_ENABLE_SDLC_WORKSPACES", use the following instructions to do so:
```
<contents from feature gating google doc, under "Add a feature flag", here>
``````
Feature gating google doc (https://docs.google.com/document/d/1XbszN-7RRfv6uSYcdGzLmcEumy1dYu5xM8Nazp1TJBs/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.pdwxwaa98vjk)

I don’t think Cursor enables sharing prompts directly, but we can just copy, paste, and save them. Aside from prompts, there are some good Cursor rules floating around, like on dotcursorrules.com (http://dotcursorrules.com).
Good reference! Honestly, I wonder if we can share prompts within the repo itself. e.g. Add useful cursor prompts into a `.cursorrules` file/folder and let cursor find the correct prompt to use

That should work!
Project rules can be stored in the `.cursor/rules` directory and provide granular control over AI behavior in different parts of project.

I found Cursor’s Project Rules (https://docs.cursor.com/context/rules-for-ai#project-rules-recommended) and it’s basically what you said @alex.zhou. Playing around with it, I couldn’t get Composer to automatically pick up the rule I defined, but I works when I manually specify the rule via the “@” char in the prompt (see video).
